description:
The quality of education in Fort Bend County has long been a driving force to attract families to the area. Fort Bend County is one of the fastest-growing counties in the nation. As the largest school district in the county, Fort Bend ISD is an outstanding K-12 public education system.

The District is Texas’ sixth largest with more than 80,000 students and one of the most diverse in the nation. Working and learning cohesively alongside families who speak more than 100 languages and dialects, the schools work together with students, their families and the community to address each student’s unique needs.

FBISD currently has 82 campuses: 11 high schools, 15 middle schools, 51 elementary campuses and five specialty schools to address the academic and vocational interests of students. With more than 11,000 full-time employees and substitutes, the District is the largest employer in Fort Bend County.

Fort Bend ISD is committed to its mission to inspire and equip all students to pursue futures beyond what they can imagine.
name: Fort Bend ISD

similar_companies.name: Association of College and University Educators (ACUE)

updates.text: Fort Bend ISD is developing pathways for our student and resident teachers at the Q2 Professional Development event! This is an excellent opportunity to train, educate, and connect with hiring principals while gaining valuable insights to enhance their skills. #education #studentteacher #professionaldevelopment #leadthepac

Fort Bend ISD is searching for passionate and dedicated individuals who are ready to make their impact in one of the most culturally diverse school districts in the nation! On Wednesday, June 5, campus and district leaders will be on hand to meet with candidates in the following job areas: 
Teachers (General, Special Education, and Career and Technical Education)
Paraprofessionals
Nurses
Librarians
Instructional Apprentices*
Elementary Candidates: 1:00 p.m. – 3:00 p.m.
Middle/High School Candidates: 4:00 p.m. – 6:00 p.m.
To register and for more information visit https://lnkd.in/g3icQw9q

The FBISD Small Business Enterprise Program will hold a virtual information session on September 25th for vendors and small businesses that are interested in doing business with the district.
 
The event will focus on the required criteria for businesses interested in obtaining FBISD contracts.
 
The session will be led by award-winning FBISD Small Business Enterprise Coordinator Jeanette Boleware. It takes place online on Wednesday, September 25, 2024 at 2 p.m. The session should last about an hour.
 
For more information and to register please visit www.fortbendisd.com/sbep.

Great turn out with on the spot hiring at Fort Bend ISD’s “Fall in Love” hiring event! We are so excited about our new team members and can’t wait for our huge district-wide hiring job fair April 6th. More details to come. 
#fallinlove #hiring2024 #education #teachers #librarians #specialeducation

MAKE YOUR IMPACT IN FBISD!
Special Education Hiring Event to be held Tuesday, September 10

Fort Bend ISD is seeking qualified and dedicated staff members to lead and support student instruction throughout state’s sixth-largest school district!

On Tuesday, September 10, campus and district leaders will be on hand to meet with candidates in the following job areas:

*Special Education Teachers
*Special Education Instructional Apprentices
*Special Education Instructional Aides

Candidates who register for the September 10 event should bring copies of their resumes and be prepared for on-the-spot interviews.

Register today here:
https://lnkd.in/gfeTQR4k
#jobfair #specialeducation

Superintendent Marc Smith personally invites you to walk down the red carpet and attend the district's largest hiring event on April 6. Join our team and make an impact in the lives of students everyday. 
https://lnkd.in/emY4ZJt
